task.summary:
feat: Implement web scraping and data extraction
This commit introduces a web scraping tool that crawls a given URL, scrapes the page content, and extracts specific information based on user-defined criteria.
The changes include: - Added `.gitignore` and `.idea` configuration files. - Created `extract_information.py` to handle data extraction from the scraped HTML. - Modified `main.py` to integrate web scraping with the information extraction process, taking user input for extraction type ('class' or 'id') and target name. - Added functionality to save visited URLs and extracted data into JSON files. - Created word docx file to save extracted data.
This commit adds significant functionality to the project, providing a base for targeted data extraction from websites.

feat: Add requirements.txt and update README.md
This commit introduces a `requirements.txt` file to manage project dependencies and updates the `README.md` file to provide a more comprehensive project description, including features like automated data extraction, customizable scraping, data export, and error handling.

feat: Implement GUI with Tkinter for web scraping and data extraction
This commit introduces a graphical user interface (GUI) using Tkinter to provide a more user-friendly experience for the web scraping and data extraction process. The GUI allows users to input a URL, initiate web scraping, and then specify whether to extract data based on class or ID, along with the corresponding name. Error handling and user feedback are provided through message boxes. The `pyfiglet` library has been integrated to display an ASCII art title.

feat: Implement web scraping GUI using CustomTkinter
This commit introduces a modern GUI for the web scraper using the CustomTkinter library. The GUI includes input fields for the URL, browse button to select file, radio buttons to select class or id, displays loading, extraction buttons, and overall improved user experience.
Includes code to improve webscrap.py to have human-like browser.

feat: Implement dynamic web scraping and data extraction
This commit introduces several enhancements:
- Added a stop crawling button to the GUI - Integrated a dynamic target extraction mechanism. - Modified the extraction functionality to accept multiple class/ID targets using a string format. - Enhanced the UI to accommodate the new extraction features, including a JSON file selection. - Changed set_appearance_mode to system from dark - Save the scraper instance to stop driver when GUI stop

feat: Add stop scraping functionality and UI improvements
This commit introduces the ability to stop the web scraping process mid-crawl. A stop button has been added to the main UI, which sets a `stop_flag` in the `WebScraper` class. This flag is checked periodically during crawling to halt the process gracefully.
Additional changes:
- The UI now includes an "Exit" button to close the application. - The application title in the ascii art is now "Scraper". - The layout of the buttons has been improved. - Fixed an error where the scraping error callback would trigger after stopping the scraper. - Changed "Start Over" button to "Back to main".

feat: Implement dark mode toggle and app logo
This commit introduces a dark mode toggle for the application and adds a logo for improved branding. A dark mode toggle button has been implemented. A container frame has been introduced. The logo has been integrated into main frame.

feat: Implement dark mode toggle and app logo
This commit introduces a dark mode toggle for the application and adds a logo for improved branding. A dark mode toggle button has been implemented. A container frame has been introduced. The logo has been integrated into main frame.

feat: Implement dark mode toggle and app logo
This commit introduces a dark mode toggle for the application and adds a logo for improved branding. A dark mode toggle button has been implemented. A container frame has been introduced. The logo has been integrated into main frame.

chore: Update workspace.xml
This commit updates the `.idea/workspace.xml` file. This file contains IntelliJ IDEA's workspace settings, including recently opened files, run configurations, and other IDE-specific preferences. The changes include updated keyToString values and a new local task.

Includes code to improve webscrap.py to have human-like browser.

- Added a stop button to halt the crawling process. - Improved data extraction with mixed class/ID targetting. - Enhanced UI for better user experience.

- Added a stop crawling button to the GUI - Integrated a dynamic target extraction mechanism. - Modified the extraction functionality to accept multiple class/ID targets using a string format. - Enhanced the UI to accommodate the new extraction features, including a JSON file selection. - Changed set_appearance_mode to system from dark - Save the scraper instance to stop driver when GUI stop
